reference.title: The format attribute
reference.shortdesc: The format attribute identifies the format of the resource being cross referenced. The processing default for format is dita.

section.title: Using the format attribute
section.p: Possible values for this attribute include:

dlentry.dd: The destination uses DITA topic markup, or markup specialized from a DITA topic. Unless otherwise specified, the corresponding default type will be treated as "topic."
The format of the linked-to resource is HTML or XHTML.
The format of the linked-to resource is PDF (opens a new window).
The linked-to resource is a DITA map. It represents a referenced hierarchy at a position within referencing hierarchy, and a referenced relationship table included outside the referencing hierarchy

section.p: For other formats, you can use the file extension without the "." (for example, in a link to file "readme.txt", use "txt" as the value).
